body.p:
Frankfort Kentucky
November 27. 1863
Brig. General Boyle
Louisville Ky.

I have just been to see the Governor about the money of mine found on the body of Mary Crouch, that James Keller stole from me and left with her. The Governor has been looking for the money from Mount-Sterling by your order, but it seems that the money has not come yet. I am in great distress for money -- and am afraid to go out of town. The Guerillas and friends of Keller, whom I killed, are watching ^over^ my life. Please send an order to Mt Sterling for the money. Capt. Williams, Provost Marshall at Mt. Sterling, deposited the money in the Bank there subject to your order.

Yours
Wm Watkins
W 155 (DK) 1863
Frankfort Ky Nov 27
Watkins, Wm
Requests an order for some money deposited at Mt Sterling subject to the order of the Genl Comdg found on the body of Mary Cruch which one James Keller stole from him.

Recd Hd Qrs (DK) Nov 28th 63
Head'qrs Dist of Ky
Louisvile Ky
Nov 29th 63
Respectfuly referred to Hon Thomas E Bramlette Governor of Kentucky, at Frankfort Ky. enclosing order on Bank at Mt Sterling for the money of Watkins.
